alert.note: Alert for North Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 3:48PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorm winds will impact portions of south central Big Horn and northeastern Washakie Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 347 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of thunderstorms near Worland, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Storms will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Big Horn and northeastern Washakie Counties, including the following locations... Leigh Creek Campground, Wigwam Fish Rearing Station and Washakie County Fairgrounds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
